item.title: The tide turns on pediatric transition care
item.description: Malpractice suit and shifting clinical guidelines show cracks in transgender orthodoxy.

item.title: Cartoon by Lisa Benson
item.description: Lisa Benson cartoon on California’s wealth tax driving away residents.

item.title: A federal judge schools chaotic Kristi Noem
item.description: Blocking a government attempt to end temporary protected status for about 353,000 Haitians in the U.S.

item.title: A viral infection can have devastating effects. I experienced this firsthand.
item.description: The consequences of the anti-vaccine movement reach beyond today’s controversies.

item.title: Christianity at the Super Bowl defies a trend
item.description: The Super Bowl shows how football and faith have become intertwined.

item.title: Are Americans getting richer? New data might surprise you.
item.description: Workers have proven resilient over the past decade, despite inflation and valid affordability fears.

item.title: Steer clear
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on Disney’s new CEO, Josh D’Amaro.

item.title: Step one on ‘affordability’ can’t be tax hikes
item.description: Virginia Democrats would be unwise to jack up income taxes despite a budget surplus.

item.title: The alarming trend of psychedelic microdosing
item.description: Some psychedelic medications hold great promise, but people should be wary of self-treatment.

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard is showing why her job shouldn’t exist
item.description: Trump’s director of national intelligence is making worse the problems with the ill-conceived role.

item.title: Giving immigration courts the judges they need is a win-win
item.description: A backlog of 3.4 million cases is inhumane and economically short-sighted.

item.title: Calls to ‘defund ICE’ are horrifying
item.description: The chair of the Interagency Autism Coordinating Committee on autism policy, plus readers on crypto and ICE’s tactics.

item.title: What to make of Trump’s ‘excellent’ call with Xi
item.description: He has taken a softer approach against America’s chief rival during his first year back in office.

item.title: No, Billie Eilish, Americans are not thieves on stolen land
item.description: Civilization depends on secure property titles, not sincere apologies.

item.title: I work with AI for a living. This marketing ploy is repugnant.
item.description: Companies have an incentive to make you believe that chatbots are conscious. Don’t fall for it.

item.title: Trump’s impunity reflects a malignant legacy
item.description: How post-9/11 U.S. policy set up today’s strong-arm tactics by the federal government.

item.title: Democrats have an early front-runner
item.description: Gavin Newsom’s bet on joyful combat and coiffed charisma is paying dividends.

item.title: Senators should press Trump’s Fed nominee on these comments
item.description: Kevin Warsh’s vision for a less political central bank warrants scrutiny.

item.title: This change is diluting what makes the Olympics special
item.description: The most geographically scattered Games in history could dilute festival experience.

item.title: Blue states banning cooperation with ICE will backfire
item.description: The Trump administration’s immigration excesses are no excuse for Democrats to adopt their own.

item.title: Walmart became a trillion-dollar company by evolving
item.description: The world’s largest private employer refused to compromise on profits. That paid off for workers.

item.title: Building a new house? This little-known rule could cost you thousands.
item.description: Stormwater regulations are driving up the cost of homes across the country.

item.title: Sen. Edward J. Markey: What’s really keeping energy bills high
item.description: Sen. Edward J. Markey on clean energy, plus readers on coal, the Kennedy Center and alternatives to four-year college.

item.title: The choice that will define the president’s place in history
item.description: Trump warned Tehran not to hurt protesters, and it killed thousands. His choice now is clear.
